summary: Generate coverage summary information for reads data

arguments.summary: If true, adds a PG tag to created SAM/BAM/CRAM files.
arguments.name: --add-output-sam-program-record

arguments.summary: If true, adds a command line header line to created VCF files.
arguments.name: --add-output-vcf-command-line

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: Calculate coverage statistics over this list of genes
arguments.name: --calculate-coverage-over-genes
arguments.fulltext:
Specify a RefSeq file for use in aggregating coverage statistics over genes.

This argument is incompatible with --omit-interval-statistics. A warning will be logged and no output file will be produced for the gene list if these arguments are enabled together.

arguments.summary: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable). Defaults to cloudPrefetchBuffer if unset.
arguments.name: --cloud-index-prefetch-buffer

arguments.summary: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable).
arguments.name: --cloud-prefetch-buffer

arguments.summary: How should overlapping reads from the same fragment be handled? NOTE: currently only COUNT_READS is supported
arguments.name: --count-type

options.summary: Count all reads independently (even if from the same fragment).
options.name: COUNT_READS

options.summary: Count all fragments (even if the reads that compose the fragment are not consistent at that base).
options.name: COUNT_FRAGMENTS

options.summary: Count all fragments (but only if the reads that compose the fragment are consistent at that base).
options.name: COUNT_FRAGMENTS_REQUIRE_SAME_BASE

arguments.summary: If true, create a BAM/CRAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM/CRAM file.
arguments.name: --create-output-bam-index

arguments.summary: If true, create a MD5 digest for any BAM/SAM/CRAM file created
arguments.name: --create-output-bam-md5

arguments.summary: If true, create a VCF index when writing a coordinate-sorted VCF file.
arguments.name: --create-output-variant-index

arguments.summary: If true, create a a MD5 digest any VCF file created.
arguments.name: --create-output-variant-md5

arguments.summary: If true, don't cache bam indexes, this will reduce memory requirements but may harm performance if many intervals are specified.  Caching is automatically disabled if there are no intervals specified.
arguments.name: --disable-bam-index-caching

arguments.summary: Read filters to be disabled before analysis
arguments.name: --disable-read-filter

arguments.summary: If specified, do not check the sequence dictionaries from our inputs for compatibility. Use at your own risk!
arguments.name: --disable-sequence-dictionary-validation

arguments.summary: Disable all tool default read filters (WARNING: many tools will not function correctly without their default read filters on)
arguments.name: --disable-tool-default-read-filters

arguments.summary: One or more genomic intervals to exclude from processing
arguments.name: --exclude-intervals
arguments.fulltext:
Use this argument to exclude certain parts of the genome from the analysis (like -L, but the opposite).
 This argument can be specified multiple times. You can use samtools-style intervals either explicitly on the
 command line (e.g. -XL 1 or -XL 1:100-200) or by loading in a file containing a list of intervals
 (e.g. -XL myFile.intervals).

arguments.summary: A configuration file to use with the GATK.
arguments.name: --gatk-config-file

arguments.summary: If the GCS bucket channel errors out, how many times it will attempt to re-initiate the connection
arguments.name: --gcs-max-retries

arguments.summary: Project to bill when accessing "requester pays" buckets. If unset, these buckets cannot be accessed.  User must have storage.buckets.get permission on the bucket being accessed.
arguments.name: --gcs-project-for-requester-pays

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: Ignore sites consisting only of deletions
arguments.name: --ignore-deletion-sites

arguments.summary: Include information on deletions alongside other bases in output table counts
arguments.name: --include-deletions
arguments.fulltext: Consider a spanning deletion as contributing to coverage. Also enables deletion counts in per-base output.

arguments.summary: Include sites where the reference is N
arguments.name: --include-ref-n-sites
arguments.fulltext: Normally, sites where the reference is N (or another non-canonical base) are skipped. If this option is enabled, these sites will be included in DoC calculations if there is coverage from neighboring reads.

arguments.summary: BAM/SAM/CRAM file containing reads
arguments.name: --input

arguments.summary: Amount of padding (in bp) to add to each interval you are excluding.
arguments.name: --interval-exclusion-padding
arguments.fulltext:
Use this to add padding to the intervals specified using -XL. For example, '-XL 1:100' with a
 padding value of 20 would turn into '-XL 1:80-120'. This is typically used to add padding around targets when
 analyzing exomes.

arguments.summary: Interval merging rule for abutting intervals
arguments.name: --interval-merging-rule
arguments.fulltext:
By default, the program merges abutting intervals (i.e. intervals that are directly side-by-side but do not
 actually overlap) into a single continuous interval. However you can change this behavior if you want them to be
 treated as separate intervals instead.

arguments.summary: Amount of padding (in bp) to add to each interval you are including.
arguments.name: --interval-padding
arguments.fulltext:
Use this to add padding to the intervals specified using -L. For example, '-L 1:100' with a
 padding value of 20 would turn into '-L 1:80-120'. This is typically used to add padding around targets when
 analyzing exomes.

arguments.summary: Set merging approach to use for combining interval inputs
arguments.name: --interval-set-rule
arguments.fulltext:
By default, the program will take the UNION of all intervals specified using -L and/or -XL. However, you can
 change this setting for -L, for example if you want to take the INTERSECTION of the sets instead. E.g. to
 perform the analysis only on chromosome 1 exomes, you could specify -L exomes.intervals -L 1 --interval-set-rule
 INTERSECTION. However, it is not possible to modify the merging approach for intervals passed using -XL (they will
 always be merged using UNION).

 Note that if you specify both -L and -XL, the -XL interval set will be subtracted from the -L interval set.

options.summary: Take the union of all intervals
options.name: UNION

options.summary: Take the intersection of intervals (the subset that overlaps all intervals specified)
options.name: INTERSECTION

arguments.summary: One or more genomic intervals over which to operate
arguments.name: --intervals

arguments.summary: Lenient processing of VCF files
arguments.name: --lenient

arguments.summary: Maximum quality of bases to count towards depth
arguments.name: --max-base-quality
arguments.fulltext: Bases with quality scores higher than this threshold will be skipped. The default value is the largest number that can be represented as a byte.

arguments.summary: Maximum number of reads to retain per sample per locus. Reads above this threshold will be downsampled. Set to 0 to disable.
arguments.name: --max-depth-per-sample

arguments.summary: If non-zero, partitions VCF output into shards, each containing up to the given number of records.
arguments.name: --max-variants-per-shard

arguments.summary: Minimum quality of bases to count towards depth
arguments.name: --min-base-quality
arguments.fulltext: Bases with quality scores lower than this threshold will be skipped. This is set to -1 by default to disable the evaluation and ignore this threshold.

arguments.summary: Number of bins to use for granular binning
arguments.name: --nBins
arguments.fulltext: Sets the number of bins for granular binning

arguments.summary: Do not output depth of coverage at each base
arguments.name: --omit-depth-output-at-each-base
arguments.fulltext: Disabling the tabulation of total coverage at every base should speed up processing.

arguments.summary: Do not output gene summary if it was not completely covered by traversal intervals
arguments.name: --omit-genes-not-entirely-covered-by-traversal
arguments.fulltext: Remove genes from the gene summary output file if all of its exon bases were not completely covered by traversal.

arguments.summary: Do not calculate per-interval statistics
arguments.name: --omit-interval-statistics
arguments.fulltext: Disabling the tabulation of interval statistics (mean, median, quartiles AND # intervals by sample by coverage) should speed up processing.

arguments.summary: Do not calculate per-sample per-depth counts of loci
arguments.name: --omit-locus-table
arguments.fulltext: Disabling the tabulation of locus statistics (# loci covered by sample by coverage) should speed up processing.

arguments.summary: Do not output the summary files per-sample
arguments.name: --omit-per-sample-statistics
arguments.fulltext: This option simply disables writing separate files for per-sample summary statistics (total, mean, median, quartile coverage per sample). These statistics are still calculated internally, so enabling this option will not improve runtime.

arguments.summary: Base file location to which to write coverage summary information, must be a path to a file
arguments.name: --output
arguments.fulltext: Base file name about which to create the coverage information

arguments.summary: The format of the output file
arguments.name: --output-format
arguments.fulltext: Output file format (e.g. csv, table, rtable); defaults to r-readable table.

arguments.summary: Partition type for depth of coverage
arguments.name: --partition-type
arguments.fulltext: By default, coverage is partitioned by sample, but it can be any combination of sample, readgroup and/or library.

arguments.summary: Add base counts to per-locus output
arguments.name: --print-base-counts
arguments.fulltext: Instead of reporting depth, the program will report the base pileup at each locus

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Read filters to be applied before analysis
arguments.name: --read-filter

arguments.summary: Indices to use for the read inputs. If specified, an index must be provided for every read input and in the same order as the read inputs. If this argument is not specified, the path to the index for each input will be inferred automatically.
arguments.name: --read-index

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM/BAM/CRAM/SRA files read by this program.  The default stringency value SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --read-validation-stringency

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file
arguments.name: --reference

arguments.summary: Output traversal statistics every time this many seconds elapse
arguments.name: --seconds-between-progress-updates

arguments.summary: Use the given sequence dictionary as the master/canonical sequence dictionary.  Must be a .dict file.
arguments.name: --sequence-dictionary

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: If true, don't emit genotype fields when writing vcf file output.
arguments.name: --sites-only-vcf-output

arguments.summary: Starting (left endpoint) for granular binning
arguments.name: --start
arguments.fulltext: Sets the low-coverage cutoff for granular binning. All loci with depth < START are counted in the first bin.

arguments.summary: Ending (right endpoint) for granular binning
arguments.name: --stop
arguments.fulltext: Sets the high-coverage cutoff for granular binning. All loci with depth > STOP are counted in the last bin.

arguments.summary: Coverage threshold (in percent) for summarizing statistics
arguments.name: --summary-coverage-threshold
arguments.fulltext: For summary file outputs, report the percentage of bases covered to an amount equal to or greater than this number  (e.g. % bases >= CT for each sample). Defaults to 15; can take multiple arguments.

arguments.summary: Temp directory to use.
arguments.name: --tmp-dir

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkDeflater (as opposed to IntelDeflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-deflater

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkInflater (as opposed to IntelInflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-inflater

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --verbosity

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description:
Assess sequence coverage by a wide array of metrics, partitioned by sample, read group, or library

This tool processes a set of bam files to determine coverage at different levels of partitioning and aggregation. Coverage can be analyzed per locus, per interval, per gene, or in total; can be partitioned by sample, by read group, by technology, by center, or by library; and can be summarized by mean, median, quartiles, and/or percentage of bases covered to or beyond a threshold. Additionally, reads and bases can be filtered by mapping or base quality score.

Input

  • One or more bam files (with proper headers) to be analyzed for coverage statistics
  • (Optional) A REFSEQ file to aggregate coverage to the gene level (for information about creating the REFSEQ file, please consult the online documentation)

Output

Tables pertaining to different coverage summaries. Suffix on the table files declares the contents:

  • no suffix: per locus coverage
  • _summary: total, mean, median, quartiles, and threshold proportions, aggregated over all bases
  • _statistics: coverage histograms (# locus with X coverage), aggregated over all bases
  • _interval_summary: total, mean, median, quartiles, and threshold proportions, aggregated per interval
  • _interval_statistics: 2x2 table of # of intervals covered to >= X depth in >=Y samples
  • _gene_summary: total, mean, median, quartiles, and threshold proportions, aggregated per gene
  • _gene_statistics: 2x2 table of # of genes covered to >= X depth in >= Y samples. In its current incarnation it will not include genes not at least partially covered (see --omit-genes-not-entirely-covered-by-traversal for details)
  • _cumulative_coverage_counts: coverage histograms (# locus with >= X coverage), aggregated over all bases
  • _cumulative_coverage_proportions: proprotions of loci with >= X coverage, aggregated over all bases

Notes

  • DepthOfCoverage currently only supports typical nucleotide (and N) bases, IUPAC ambiguity codes or other non-ATCGN bases will cause exceptions
  • Read filters are applied to the reads before being counted in coverage information. By default Duplicate Marked and non-primary alignments are not counted. This can be disabled with --disable-tool-default-read-filters.
  • In order to filter reads out by their mapping qualities, the recommended approach is to use the MappingQualityReadFilter with the --minimum-mapping-quality or --maximum-mapping-quality arguments specified

Usage example

 gatk \
   DepthOfCoverage \
   -R reference.fasta \
   -O file_name_base \
   -I input_bams.list
   [-gene-list refSeq.sorted.refseq] \
   [-partition-type readgroup] \
   [--summary-coverage-threshold 4 --summary-coverage-threshold 6 --summary-coverage-threshold 10] \
   [-L my_capture_genes.interval_list]
name: DepthOfCoverage
